results.title: Forever young
results.creator_credit: Robin Lehman and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Examines the fear of aging and what post-retirement years are really like by interviewing a group of active, interested people, all over the age of 65. They speak of their enjoyment and appreciation of life, their health, happiness, retirement, sex and death.

results.title: Forests of pine
results.brief_description: The steps in pine plantation management and a rationale for their use. Details of the various types of forests in Tasmania, their climatic conditions and locations. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Forests and conservation
results.brief_description: The critical problem of how to conserve and utilize the forest resources of USA. Selective logging, re-afforestation and fire-prevention are three of the most vital methods.

results.title: Foresters Island
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Portrays the development of the timber resources of Tasmania from the earliest settlement of the State through to the present day large-scale timber operations and the management of the resource by the State Forestry Commission.

results.title: Foresters
results.brief_description: There has been greater progress in the science of forestry during the past several decades than in any previous time, and it is the practitioner of the trade, the professional forester, whose day-to-day work is most responsible for making effective the discoveries, experiments and research carried on at forestry stations across Canada. This film shows both the modern technology of the timberlands and the role of the forester in the preservation and regeneration of this great natural resource.

results.title: Forest without spears
results.creator_credit: Lionel Hudson, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Bulolo Valley in New Guinea was once a mere hunting ground; now it is the home of the Commonwealth New Guinea Timbers, a company cutting 10 million square feet of Klinki pine a year. Compares pre-war mining operations by dredge and the forestry industry of today; the milling operations, growing seedling trees, felling mature ones; transport; transformation into the finished product; importance to the people of the area of the industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Hudson, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Forest under siege
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Desmond Dew and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Two million six hundred square kilometres of forest are the feeding-grounds of armies of insects. This film shows the devastation, its causes, and the many ways in which the Canadian Forestry Service, with the help of the provincial governments, is fighting this vast attack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Desmond Dew and ONF | NFB

results.title: Forest to foundry
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Wundowie, Western Australia is known for its sawmills and its pig-iron foundry. It is in the midst of the jarrah country and two sawmills produce high grade timber. Iron ore is brought to Wundowie from the quarries and there reduced to pig-iron in blast furnaces with the charcoal produced from the timber waste.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit

results.title: Forest fire suppression [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Cherry, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Live action, animated sketches and maps are used to provide a detailed demonstration of how a forest fire is brought under control. The film describes the various factors - water supply, road transportation, type of timber stands, and direction of wind - which firefighters take into account in planning their attack and deploying equipment. It shows the actual fighting of a fire, and the mopping-up operations and close watch that must follow to safeguard against a renewed outbreak.
